meanings.definition: The practice or art of eating and drinking to excess.
meanings.sent1: Her gourmandisms at the buffet were evident as she piled her plate high with food.
meanings.sent2: His gourmandisms often led him to try every dessert on the menu.
meanings.sent3: Despite his small stature, his gourmandisms knew no bounds when faced with a chocolate fountain.
meanings.sent4: The gourmandisms of the food critic were as voracious as a lion hunting its prey.
meanings.sent5: The image of his gourmandisms lingered in the minds of all who witnessed his feast.

meanings.definition: Excessive indulgence in the pleasures of good food and drink.
meanings.sent1: The restaurant's decadent desserts catered to the gourmandisms of its patrons.
meanings.sent2: Her gourmandisms were evident in the way she savored every bite of the gourmet meal.
meanings.sent3: His gourmandisms were so extreme that he once ordered three entrees for himself.
meanings.sent4: The gourmandisms of the food connoisseur were like a symphony of flavors on his palate.
meanings.sent5: The memory of her gourmandisms lingered like a sweet aftertaste in the minds of her friends.
